lead_paragraph: On the snow-flecked shore of Mountain Pond in Paul Smiths, N.Y., the biologist Tom Shanahan kneaded the speckled belly of a brook trout, squirting a cascade of bright yellow eggs into an enameled pan.
snippet: On the snow-flecked shore of Mountain Pond in Paul Smiths, N.Y., the biologist Tom Shanahan kneaded the speckled belly of a brook trout, squirting a cascade of bright yellow eggs into an enameled pan.
